name: Tayba Foundation
mission:
Tayba aims to become a pioneer—the first to offer a complete, high-quality online curriculum featuring engaging visual and audio instruction Our programs SOURCE: Self-reported by organization What are the organization's current programs, how do they measure success,
            and who do the programs serve? Education At Tayba, we believe that character reformation gives incarcerated clients and the formerly incarcerated the tools they need to successfully reintegrate into society following parole.
theoryOfChange: Tayba Foundation articulates its strategic framework through its mission and detailed program descriptions. The organization believes in "human change through holistic education, guidance, and support". Their work is structured around three interconnected program areas: Education, Life Skills, and Re-entry. The educational philosophy focuses on "character reformation through spiritual and behavioral modification," with a twofold purpose of nurturing self-awareness and encouraging self-discovery and transformation through healthy choices. Life Skills programs aim to equip clients with relational, financial, and problem-solving skills for successful reintegration. Re-entry services include mentoring, continuing education, resume support, networking, and job training. The foundation also mentions using "evidence-based parole plans" and "effective assessment methods" to reflect understanding of course material. Their "Our Goals for 2021" document further outlines specific objectives within these program areas, demonstrating a planned approach to achieving their mission.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.taybafoundation.org/zakat (Source: https://www.taybafoundation.org/zakat)

all_citations.claim: The organization holds a Charity Navigator score of 94.25/100, a program expense ratio of 84.6%, 6.7 months of working capital, and a fundraising efficiency of $0.18 per $1 raised.
The Tayba Foundation is Zakat-eligible and maintains a specific zakat policy.
The organization reported a total revenue of $1,460,391.
Tayba offers a complete online curriculum for character reformation and follows a structured Zakat distribution process.
The foundation provides various donation options including company matching programs.
The organization offers volunteer opportunities and engagement through its board.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The Tayba Foundation earns a solid overall rating due to its high financial accountability and efficient fundraising, though its impact score reflects a capacity-building model with a specific cost per beneficiary.
areas_for_improvement: Moderate alignment score suggests opportunities to further strengthen donor fit and cause urgency [1]
Impact directness is categorized as capacity building rather than direct service delivery [1]

dimension_explanations.alignment: Tayba shows a medium donor fit with an alignment score of 32/50, serving a specific religious and cultural niche within the carceral system [1]. The organization is explicitly Zakat-eligible, adhering to specific asnaf categories for its distribution process [2][4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates high financial efficiency with a fundraising efficiency of $0.18 per $1 raised and holds 6.7 months of working capital [1][3]. While the impact score of 40/50 is strong, it reflects a capacity-building approach with a calculated cost per beneficiary of approximately $511.54 [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Tayba Foundation provides high-quality educational and re-entry programs designed to facilitate character reformation and successful reintegration for incarcerated individuals.
strengths: High program expense ratio of 84.6%, indicating most funds go directly to services [1]
Strong financial health with a Charity Navigator score of 94.25/100 [1]
Zakat-eligible status with a transparent distribution process [2][4]
baseline_narrative.summary: The Tayba Foundation is a non-profit organization that offers a comprehensive online curriculum featuring visual and audio instruction for incarcerated and formerly incarcerated clients [4]. With a total revenue of $1,460,391, the organization focuses on education, life skills, and re-entry services to reduce recidivism [3][4].

rich_narrative.headline: The Tayba Foundation provides high-quality educational and re-entry programs designed to facilitate character reformation and successful reintegration for incarcerated individuals.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who value the transformative power of Islamic education and want to support the successful re-entry of incarcerated Muslims into society.
donor_motivations: Want to support a niche, underserved population within the Ummah
Believe in education as the primary tool for character reformation
Seek to fulfill zakat through a highly transparent, US-based organization
Value high accountability scores from third-party evaluators
giving_considerations: Gifts support long-term educational tracks rather than immediate physical relief
The organization operates in a complex regulatory environment (US prison system)
Impact is measured by long-term behavioral change and recidivism rates
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking international emergency disaster relief or those prioritizing low-cost-per-meal metrics.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: The foundation tracks <cite id="16">two key outcome metrics</cite> and reports a <cite id="8">100% non-recidivism rate</cite>.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: Tayba uses Islamic education to reform character, which directly leads to lower recidivism and successful societal reintegration.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that educational programs are effectively changing lives and not just providing content.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="3">$1.46M revenue</cite> and a significant funding gap, Tayba has high capacity to expand its curriculum to more facilities.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Tayba's <cite id="10">84.6% program ratio</cite> is competitive within its peer group median of <cite id="17">81.7%</cite>.

strengths.detail: The organization holds an <cite id="5">overall score of 94.94.25/100 from Charity Navigator</cite> and a <cite id="9">Candid Platinum Seal of Transparency</cite>.
Tayba maintains a <cite id="10">program expense ratio of 84.6%</cite>, ensuring the majority of funds support educational services.
Internal tracking reports a <cite id="8">non-recidivism rate of 100%</cite> for students completing their core programs.

strengths_deep_dive: Tayba Foundation distinguishes itself through a lean operational model that achieves a <cite id="11">fundraising efficiency of $0.18 per $1 raised</cite>. This efficiency is paired with a robust <cite id="12">working capital reserve of 6.7 months</cite>, providing significant organizational stability. Their educational model is highly direct, utilizing <cite id="1">236 chaplains and over 3,600 volunteer faith providers</cite> to deliver services within the prison system. Furthermore, the organization is governed by an <cite id="13">independent board of 6 members</cite>, ensuring objective oversight of its $1.46 million budget.
rich_narrative.summary: The Tayba Foundation is a specialized non-profit organization dedicated to providing <cite id="1">high-quality Islamic education and re-entry support</cite> for incarcerated individuals across the United States. Operating as a pioneer in its field, the foundation offers a <cite id="2">comprehensive online curriculum</cite> featuring visual and audio instruction designed to facilitate character reformation. With a <cite id="3">total revenue of $1,460,391</cite>, Tayba focuses on reducing recidivism through a holistic approach that includes <cite id="4">life skills and Tayba Research programs</cite>. The organization maintains a strong financial standing, evidenced by an <cite id="5">overall score of 94.94.25/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>, reflecting high standards of accountability and transparency. For Muslim donors, Tayba offers a <cite id="6">verified zakat-eligible giving option</cite>, ensuring that contributions directly support eligible students through a <cite id="7">transparent distribution process</cite> that has historically achieved a <cite id="8">100% non-recidivism rate</cite> among its core participants.
